title: League installed but fails to complete initial load
body:
Built a new PC and am having problems finishing the LoL install. I've tried to install as admin, as guest. I've tried to uninstall and reinstall, tried to let it sit for a few hours to see if it completed in the background. I've tried to download someone elses install files. All hardware works as far as I can tell, no probs with any other games. Drivers up to date.

After install the program opens with the league of legends icon in the middle of the screen with the load bar beneath it, makes it about 3/4 of the bar then closes. Processes show LoL Patcher (32bit) still running.

Lost and not sure what to do.

replies.body:
When the patcher won't launch, it could be caused by a number of issues. By far the most common is that League is not configured to run with proper system permissions. Since League accessing a number of files and software packages outside the League install, it needs certain administrative privileges in order to run properly. As a first step, I recommend ensuring League has these privileges by working through our [permissions guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

Let me know if this issue persists.
Still no luck. I tried tricks in the link to no avail.

Gotcha. If you have a firewall or antivirus, it could be preventing League from properly reaching the server, which prevents it from coming up. I suggest adding exceptions in your firewall/AV or temporarily disabling it to see if League will launch. [This link](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3) should be able to help you.

Let me know if that worked.
